communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Operation Endgame
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- records on the investigation(s) under Operation Endgame
- records on the investigation(s) under Operation Dying Ember
- all memos, briefings, meeting notes, bulletins and email communication mentioning Operation Endgame
- all memos, briefings, meeting notes, bulletins and email communication mentioning Operation Dying Ember
- all records in regard to public disclosure/announcement of Operation Endgame (such as releases, talking points, notices, etc)
- all records in regard to public disclosure/announcement of Operation Dying Ember (such as releases, talking points, notices, etc)
- all records on the cooperation of agents/departments for Operation Endgame and Operation Dying Embe, including coordination between field offices

In addition to standard practices, please conduct:

- Searches of the Electronic Case File System (ECF)
- Searches of Special Agent in Charge (SAC) safes
- Searches of SENTINEL
- Searches of Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices
- Searches of the Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW), including IDW-S, SPT, and DOCLAB-S sub-systems/indices
- Searches of the Data Integration and Visualization System (DIVS)

I request all cross-referenced records be provided. If any responsive or cross-referenced records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, please provide all records related/pursuant to their destruction/transfer. This includes but is not limited to:

- Confirmation of destruction and destruction slips
- File Numbers or other forms of ID of the aforementioned destroyed records
- Documents/records with any references to the destruction of the aforementioned destroyed records.
- Transfer slips
- Any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records

I want **ALL** records identifiable with this request, even though reports based on those records may have been sent to department headquarters or other department offices, and even though there may be duplication between sets of files. Please produce all records with their administrative markings intact, and all reports, memos, and documents to include any and all administrative pages. In any responsive material, please black out rather than white out or cut out material.

I request the administrative case file (including search slips and processing notes, i.e email correspondence and text messages) for this request. When searching email records, please search for any tracking information/identification assigned to this request, including but not limited to appeal number/ID, request number/ID, tracking number/ID, etc.

This part of the request is to be processed only after you have completed processing all of the above parts. This part does not request that you create any new record; rather, it requests the records that you will have created in processing the above parts, and will therefore exist before you conduct the search for this part. See McGehee v. CIA, 697 F. 2d 1095, 1100-05 (D.C. Cir. 1983) (agency must use time-of-search cut-off date, not time-of-request).

Given the anticipated amount of responsive pages, I'm requesting for interim releases of responsive records (otherwise known as a "rolling release"). 

**I ask that you understand that I am requesting any and all records concerning the subject in any way, including but not limited to those listed in the General Index and any and all other indexes.**

BACKGROUND

The Bureau has publicly spoken about these operations, including writing about it directly on fbi.gov (including the use of offensive cyber capabilities). Please see the links below:
- https://www.fbi.gov/news/press-releases/operation-endgame-coordinated-worldwide-law-enforcement-action-against-network-of-cybercriminals
- https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/justice-department-conducts-court-authorized-disruption-botnet-controlled-russian

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: Presentation materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

While teaching a forensics class to high school 20 students in June, Burlington police officers staged a surprise demonstration in which a masked gunman burst into the room and pretended to open fire. 

Teachers said BPD officers told them that they'd previously used the lesson with college students and adults, and that they wanted the event to be “as realistic as possible.”

In its statement, the Burlington Police Department said school staff approved the demonstration’s content ahead of time and agreed to let parents and students know. The simulation would involve “fake firearms in a mock shooting,” the department said it wrote to school staff on May 23. 

I am looking for:

- planning documents, memos, emails or other communications about the planning of the described demonstration
- emails between the department and the school staff about the scheduled demonstration. Please include the May 23rd email to school staff 
- after action reports or communications within the department after the incident.
- surveillance footage of the incident or recordings of the incident

As required under the law, I request that the agency provide the above records in their native digital format, where applicable (such as a CSV, Excel, or other digital data format), and transferred to me electronically. If you deny this request in whole or in part, I request that you respond with the statutory exemption underlying the denial and the reasoning therein. If an asserted exemption applies to only a portion of a record, please delete or redact the portion to which the exemption applies and provide the remainder of the record, as required under the statute.
.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: GoGoGadgetMachineLab
communications.communication:
Hello Corrina Cooke!

Note that the purpose of these requests is to populate a machine learning corpus, therefore, communications outside of these channels are neither suitable or necessary to complete this request.

If you require additional clarification regarding this request, please observe:

- I am seeking any records associated with the identifiers provided:
 Subject: The Declassification Engine
 Subject: The History Lab
 Individual: Matthew Connelly
 Organisation: Columbia University
 IndividualAddress: 403 Fayerweather Hall
 IndividualPhone: (212) 854-4563
 IndividualEmailContact: mjc96@columbia.edu

- I am seeking records for any time period from year 2000 to CURRENT_DATE.

- I am seeking these records in the public interest, without commercial purpose or intent.

- Nuclear secrets are especially sensitive in the originating classification authority work product; they are especially relevant to the entities and efforts mentioned in this request. They are particularly relevant to the public interest and global safety. Appropriate redactions are expected, however, you are required by law to respond to this request, even if denied in full for specific and warranted reasons.

- Please provide a FOI request number or identifier for further communication regarding this request.

Thank you!

Best regards,
- Martin Peck
